Pri upokojencu Gregorju mrgolelo policistov, na domu našli orožarno
Gregor Vidmar je imel doma tudi sestavine za izdelavo bomb.
04 Nov 2019, 19:51 by Bojan Rajšek



Zaradi grožnje z razstrelitvijo hiše so leta 2014 evakuirali okolico. FOTO: Marko Feist



Že pred petimi leti so policisti na domačiji v Cirkušah odkrili laboratorij in ogromno količino kemičnih snovi. FOTO: Bojan Rajšek



Kazniva dejanja je leta 2015 na sodišču priznal. FOTO: Marko Feist


VAČE – V Cirkušah pri Vačah, kjer je majhno kmečko hišo kupil Gregor Vidmar, je spet mrgolelo policistov. Pri Vidmarju, ki je časopisne stolpce polnil zaradi nevarnosti/groženj, da bo v ljubljanskem Polju razstrelil veliko količino nevarnih snovi, naj bi namreč po zavarovanju območja in skrbnem ogledu možje v modrem ponovno naleteli na pravi arzenal strelnega orožja in kemikalij.
2 leti zapora si je prvič prislužil Vidmar.
Vidmar je bil leta 2015 obsojen na dve leti zapora zaradi nasilja v družini, povzročanja splošne nevarnosti in nedovoljene proizvodnje orožja ali eksploziva in prometa z njim. Vprašanje je, kako dolgo bi skladišče kemikalij še bilo skrito pred očmi javnosti, če Vidmarjevi ženi decembra 2014 ne bi uspelo pobegniti od doma pred nasilnim možem. Kmalu sta prispela policista, Vidmar pa je pred tem po hiši že polil nafto in hotel prižgati vžigalico. Prva se ni prižgala, uspelo mu je šele z drugo, a policista sta hitro pogasila ogenj, nato pa ugotovila, da je v stavbi polno vnetljivih in strupenih kemikalij, med drugim žveplena kislina in topila. »Prisebnosti in hitrosti policistov se gre zahvaliti, da situacija ni bila usodna,« je v obrazložitvi sodbe povedala sodnica Deja Kozjek in dodala, da bi lahko bilo, če bi se požar razširil, poleg njegovega in ženinega življenja ogroženo življenje sosedov, saj gre za strnjeno naselje z vrstnimi hišami.


Že pred petimi leti so policisti na domačiji v Cirkušah odkrili laboratorij in ogromno količino kemičnih snovi. FOTO: Bojan Rajšek

Takrat 72-letni upokojeni kemijski tehnik se je tudi sam zahvalil policistoma, v sklepni besedi pa je med drugim povedal, da že več let jemlje tablete sanval, večer pred dejanjem pa da jih je pojedel okoli 15 in se zato prav ničesar ne spomni.
Gobarji našli soda in jame
Po naših informacijah se je očitno enaka zgodba začela ponovno razpletati v teh dneh, ko so domačini pri nabiranju gob naleteli na dva velika soda in tudi več izkopanih jam. Neuradno smo zvedeli, da naj bi bil za to odgovoren prav kemik iz Ljubljane.


Kazniva dejanja je leta 2015 na sodišču priznal. FOTO: Marko Feist

Na videz mirni družinski možakar, ki je po pripovedovanju domačinov pred leti v Cirkušah pri Vačah kupil nekdanjo majhno kmečko hišo, si je že prvič tudi na svojem vikendu uredil pravi laboratorij, zraven pa nakopičil več ton nevarnih snovi.Na ljubljanski policijski upravi so nam glede preiskave v teh dneh pojasnili, da so policisti po zbiranju obvestil in ogledu zasegli pet kosov strelnega orožja, več kosov nabojev različnih kalibrov, večje število bomb in eksploziva ter sestavine za izdelavo bomb (vžigalne vrvice, kemične spojine, vžigalnike itd.).»Po zaključku aktivnosti so policisti enote za protibombno zaščito predmete primerno zavarovali in jih odpeljali v shrambo, kjer bodo opravljene natančnejše analize najdenih predmetov,« nam je povedala Aleksandra Golec, tiskovna predstavnica ljubljanske policijske uprave. Dodala je, da policisti preiskujejo sum storitve kaznivega dejanja nedovoljene proizvodnje orožja ali eksploziva in prometa z njima.

Senior officer Gregory mocked police officers, found an armory at home
Gregor Vidmar also had bomb-making ingredients at home.
04 Nov 2019, 19:51 by Bojan Rajsek



The explosion of a house caused the evacuation of the surrounding area in 2014. PHOTO: Marko Feist



Five years ago, police officers discovered a laboratory and a huge amount of chemical substances on a farm in Circus. PHOTO: Bojan Rajsek



He admitted the crimes in court in 2015. PHOTO: Marko Feist


VAČE - In the Circe near Vače, where a small farmhouse was bought by Gregor Vidmar, he again scowled at the police. Vidmar, who was filling the newspaper columns with the danger / threat of blowing up a large amount of dangerous substances in Ljubljana Polje, had to secure a real arsenal of firearms and chemicals after securing the area and careful inspection.
Two years in prison earned him his first Vidmar.
In 2015, Vidmar was sentenced to two years in prison for domestic violence, causing a general danger and illicit manufacture and trafficking of weapons or explosives. The question is how long the chemical warehouse would still be hidden from the public eye if Vidmar's wife failed to escape from her abusive home in December 2014. The police arrived soon, and Vidmar had already spilled oil around the house and wanted to light a lighter. The first one did not light up, only the second one was successful, but the police quickly extinguished the fire and then found that the building was full of flammable and toxic chemicals, including sulfuric acid and solvents. "The courtesy and speed of the police officers are to be thanked that the situation was not fatal," Judge Deja Kozjek said in the reasoning of the verdict, adding that if the fire spread, his and his wife's life could endanger the lives of the neighbors, since condensed settlement with row houses.


Five years ago, police officers discovered a laboratory and a huge amount of chemical substances on a farm in Circus. PHOTO: Bojan Rajsek

At the time, the 72-year-old retired chemical technician thanked the police officers himself and said in his closing statement that he had been taking pills for many years, and that he had eaten about 15 of them the night before the act and that he did not remember anything.
Mushrooms found soda and pits
According to our information, apparently the same story has begun to unfold again these days, when locals encountered two large barrels and also several dug pits while collecting mushrooms. Unofficially, we learned that the chemist from Ljubljana was supposed to be responsible for this.


He admitted the crimes in court in 2015. PHOTO: Marko Feist

The seemingly quiet family man, who, after telling the locals years ago, bought a former farmhouse in Cirkus near Vače, set up a real laboratory for his first weekend and accumulated several tons of dangerous substances. investigations these days clarified that after collecting notices and viewing, police seized five firearms, several bullets of various calibers, a larger number of bombs and explosives, and bomb-making components (ignition strings, chemical compounds, lighters, etc.). the completion of the activities was adequately secured by the officers of the Anti-Bomb Protection Unit and taken to a storage room for a more detailed analysis of the objects found, ”said Aleksandra Golec, a spokeswoman for the Ljubljana Police Directorate. She added that police are investigating suspicion of the criminal offense of Illicit Manufacturing of Arms or Explosives and Trafficking.
